page.title: 17Mining History
page.content: My Dad went down{Snibstone Pit}when he was 15 years old. He made sure that the empty tubs at the pit bottom were filled again. They worked 7\ hours a day on each shift and battled to see who could turn out most coal, often 1,000 tubs per shift. After 6 months my Dad started{pony driving,}pulling equipment to the coal faces. It was 1\ miles to reach their place of work. The ponies were worked very hard all day for a bag of oats. My Dad used to take a bag of grass and an apple for his pony. My Dad used to do about five runs a day. Silver was exhausted at the end of the shift, and so was my Dad. The ponies were allowed up on the surface for two weeks when the pit closed each August. They went down to Snibston Grange to enjoy a well earned rest. The ponies had their eyes covered until they got used to the sun
